content.question: A curve is defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, a, times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, b t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are positive constants. What is <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator the negative of b, and denominator 2 a, times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator the negative of b, and denominator 2 times a, squared, times t cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator the negative of b, and denominator 4 times a, squared, times t cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator the negative of b, and denominator 4 times a, squared, times t cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.2: (BC ONLY) Second Derivatives of Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
